item.title: An Overdrive Pro Connecting on OpenWrt
item.description: Have a fancy FreedomPop Overdrive Pro? Want to hook it up to your OpenWrt based router to use as a backup (or primary?) internet connection? Lets do it. Plug it into your router via USB. Then run: opkg install kmod-usb-net-cdc-ether Run dmesg and it will report which eth device came up. Mine shows up as “eth1”. Now make eth1 your “wan” interface: uci set network.wan.ifname=eth1 uci commit reboot Whoa.
